Reviews.Title: “Liked the neighbourhood”
Reviews.Author: Sarah H
Reviews.Content: The hotel its self is a bit tired, in desperate need or modernization. The rooms were extremely small, bed spreads very worn and generally quite tatty. The mattress was old and tilted to one side and I slept with the sensation of always fall off of the bed. The staff were all very friendly, the breakfast also was very good, although a yogurt and some fresh fruit would have been nice. I would definately return to the area, we found some excellent restaurants here, its was easy to get around on the metro and felt very safe at night time.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: Charlie B
Reviews.Content: Whilst dirty, tiny and definitely not even a 2 star standard, this hotel had the perfect location with many places to eat and perfect walking distance to the Metro. In the room, the floor, walls and curtains were filthy, whilst the bed linen was brand new and clean; not that it was changed every day though. The bathroom was fine apart from the sticky top to the toilet!!! The breakfast was below average with stale croissants and bread - all you get is a croissant, choc au pain and a bread roll with some jam. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful Paid £120 each for 3 nights, with flights through easy jet and if luckily this was our only saving grace. Wouldn't recommend, I'm sure Paris would offer better!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location but thats it”
Reviews.Author: truckieandthewife
Reviews.Content: If you want a romantic getaway then no this is not your hotel. But as far as location went, it rocked! The area itself has lots of places to eat and drink and price is good. There are three stations in walking distance, the closest is oberkampf. There is a food market open on Tuesdays and Fridays a block away. Rooms were clean but run down. breakfast was included in our price but if I had to pay for it I wouldnt have. It is the same thing everyday and after four days I was bored (1 roll, 1 croissant, 1 chocolate croissant, coffee/tea/ hot chocolate...instant to boot) I thought the towel, which was 90x60cms was the bathmat but alas it was the towel. You have heard of the saying "not enough room to swing a cat" well I couldn't have swung a mouse! Rooms are little but again who wants to spend all day in the hotel when you are in Paris. Very noisy! I can sleep through most things but it was very hot in tiny room but couldn't have window open because so loud was the traffic plus curtain was see through with the street lamp. Worst four nights sleep ever!

Reviews.Title: “Value for money, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: trickster16
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Mericourt hotel, rue de folies for three nights in August. We went with easy jet holidays and paid £160 for the flight and three nights which was very reasonable. The hotel is 2 star hotel but I found it to be in a perfect location, very near to the train station and the room, although quite small was very clean and had cable tv and a ample bathroom. The only downfall was the towels which are teeny so bring your own bath towels and the breakfast consists of 3 types of croissant, tea/coffee and fruit juice and that was that. We would stay there again as we found the hotel value for money. It is not situated in a tourist area and therefore is quite quite, but surrounded by bars and restaurants in the Republic area, which is a 10 minute walk up the street.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location,reasonable price, wonderful staff, exactly what I needed for my Paris shopping trip”
Reviews.Author: ML2011
Reviews.Content: Great location. Just on metro line 9, a few stops away from the "grands magasins" (Galerie Lafayette, Printemps), and a direct bus to Ile de la Cite, Saint Michel, Saint Germain. Loads of restaurants and bars around for dinner. Hotel staff is great and very helpful. Breakfastbis included in the price, and even if it is not a buffet style, it is very parisian, and vas sufficient for me. Of course the room is small but clean enough, and anyway, when coming to Paris, nobody is expecting to stay a lot of time in the room!

Reviews.Title: “Nasty”
Reviews.Author: Dijon246
Reviews.Content: Nasty! I am not a diva, but for 89 euro a night this place made my skin crawl. the walls were filthy and yellowing, there was dirty cigarette burned carpet in the room, the beds were old and overed with black hair from a previous lodger, the bathroom had an overpowering stench, and to make matters worse there was construction outside that woke us every morning. We only stayed there 2 nights which was one too many. My friend and I were just happy to have a place to stay as everyplace in Paris was booked, and the staff was friendly but I would never ever recommend this place or stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT HOTEL IN BRILLIANT LOCATION!!!”
Reviews.Author: jonny613
Reviews.Content: We visited this hotel a few years back and have gone back since numerous times. It is an excellent location, staff are fantastic and the hotel is perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Great neighborhood hotel, price and location!”
Reviews.Author: augmonster
Reviews.Content: My partner and I were very pleased with accommodations at the Mericourt. It's a neighborhood (not so toursity) hotel with all the charm of Paris. We stayed on the top floor with double wide windows that we threw open for most of our stay. One nice thing about Paris, no insects, so no need for screens. The hotel is at the corner of two narrow streets that can be noisy at night. We slept through the noise with no problem, likely due to our heavy touring schedule and exhaustion at the end of the day; however, the charm of the busy small streets was not to be missed. The hotel was clean and well looked after. The rooms are small, but cozy in typical Parisian style. We had a full private bath with tub and shower and no complaints whatsoever. There is plenty of hot water available at any time. The hotel guests were quiet and a mixed crowd of all nationalities and customs. Though some here have mentioned being able to hear guests in other rooms, we encountered no such issue. We felt we had total privacy during our entire stay. The breakfasts are not to be missed, though there is no variation from day to day. You'll receive a brioche, a croissant and a pan au chocolade (bread with chocolate bits in it). All were fresh and delicious. Likely they come from the patissiere right around the corner every morning. You also have a choice of coffee, hot chocolate, hot tea or orange juice to drink. And feel free to bring along a fresh fruit from the market around the corner if you wish. The staff at the hotel was very friendly and managed to speak English acceptably. Since the neighborhood is non-touristy, you will find few English speakers. So either brush up on your French, or be prepared to use hand signals to get your point across. We were successful getting the next door restaurant prioprietor to cook our Steak Tartar rather than serve it raw just by flipping our hands over and over as if flipping a burger on the grill. He spoke no English at all, but understood and accommodated our request. The hotel had no air conditioning; most of Paris has no air conditioning. We had no need for it, though both of us prefer cooler temperatures. No air conditioning is a not to worry issue, particularly in the month of May. Even June should be fine. Free wi-fi internet access was generally OK. There were times when we seemed to lose our connection, though. You may want to purchase an electrical adapter after you arrive in Paris, to ensure it will fit in the wall sockets at the Mericourt. We found them available at a couple of shops within 5 blocks of the hotel. Just ask at the front desk and they will direct you to Darty, down the street. Or you will run into a couple of electronics stores along your walk to Darty. Either will meet your needs for US adapters. Be sure to plan plenty of time to take advantage of the numerous bakeries, butcher shope, outdoor market (Tues and Fri in the square a couple blocks away). There are numerous shops of all sorts within a block or within 10 blocks of the hotel, depending on how much you want to explore the area. A walk around the Oberkampf neighborhood is well worth the experience. As is typical in Paris, you can while away the hours at Chez Gaston or A La Folie in the same block as the hotel. Or you can enjoy other outdoor cafes anywhere within 10 blocks...or anywhere in Paris for that matter. If you like to eat outdoors, you will LOVE Paris. This neighborhood is IDEAL: for outdoor eating. Take your choice from among hundreds of outdoor cafes available within just a few blocks of the hotel. You'll take the Oberkampf metro stop from Hotel Mericourt to most tourist destinations throughout Paris. Get a week's pass in regions 1-3 of the metro, train and bus. This will be well worth the 20 or so Euro investment for unlimited travel to all the sites you will want to see. I would highly recommend the Hotel Mericourt to any visitor to Paris, particularly anyone that wants the real (non-tourist) Paris experience. We thouroughly enjoyed our stay at the Hotel Mericourt and would return there if we ever visit Paris again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for Paris with breakfast thrown in!”
Reviews.Author: cerfblanc Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: This is a small hotel in a trendy area of Paris with friendly staff and excellent value for money as continental breakfast is thrown in - orange juice, bread, jam, butter, croissant and pain au chocolat with decent coffee. Some hotels charge 9 or 10 euros for breakfast and it is cheaper then to go to the many cafes to take breakfast, so having this in the hotel is a good start to the day. The rooms are of the size you would expect in big cities the world over ie small, with bath and shower en suite. A certain amount of refreshment of the decoration would be welcome, but the prices would be higher then. There was ample supply of hot water and the beds whilst not in their first youth were comfortable enough and clean. Although just off the rue Oberkampf, it was not noisy and we all slept well. The situation is good in that you can walk to most of the major attractions and it is about 25 minutes walk from the Gare du Nord where we arrived on the Eurostar. I go each year to Paris for the tennis at Roland Garros and spend little time in the hotel so aim for somewhere clean, quiet, comfortable and relatively cheap. If you are of like mind then I doubt you will find anything better for the money.

Reviews.Title: “A great value for the money you pay!”
Reviews.Author: diana_talpau
Reviews.Content: Pleasant hotel,not a big room but a clean one,a very small bathroom,nice staff,french breakfast(Bakery products and coffee or tea),small elevator.Not a luxurious hotel but you get what you pay for!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location for Tourist”
Reviews.Author: RabPBris Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel is well placed catch the Train from CDG to Gard du Nord then take Metro to Oberkampf it is just around the corner (8.80 Euros one way) We walked to the Louvre, Champ Elysees and Eifel Tower from here but oyu can alos access by Metro and Bus. Nearby is a small supermarket where you can buy your water and wine etc. Breakfast is basic bread Roll, Croissant and a Pain du Chocolat with Tea or Coffee and OJ. They have a little room in front of kitchen and initally we were put in what appeared to be the luggage room. If you do not have basic French you may struggle with the inital welcome and waht you get. There are numerous restaurants and bars nearby and they offer a Plat du Jour at a reasonable 12.5 Euros on average, go any further afield and it increases. A beer is about 7 Euros with a Glass of Wine about 4 Euros. The room was small but had ensuite, not all do, however worth the extra, we were rather dismayed with the constant attention of the maid trying to get us out of our room to clean on our first day as we arrived late and wished to sleeep, we even got a telephone call from reception asking us when we were going out? Not a way to treat your guests by waking them up so the maid can access your room. There are a number of British type bars and they are priced the same as local unlike in Spain and other countries where the tend to be more expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Average rooms”
Reviews.Author: TouristNerd
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week. The location is good as it is close to a few train stations which are within a 5 minute walk from the hotel. Breakfast gets boring after a while as its the same every morning 2 x croissants and a piece of bread with a different type of jam. It is a family owned hotel and they go out there way to help guests as we arrived late at night to find they didnt have a reservation for us )which was not there fault it was the internet site hotelclub.com) they did put us in another vacant room which is their emergency room and found accommodation for us the follwing morning. They even offered to move our luggage for us so we could go sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel for reasonable price in Paris”
Reviews.Author: tourise
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 3 night stay at this hotel and are very pleased with the choice we made. The hotel rooms are quite small, but very clean with perfectly adequate bathroom. Shower is very powerful. Fresh towels and maid service every day. Continental breakfast included in price which consisted of fresh roll, croissant and pan au chocolate, orange juice and pot of tea, coffee or chocolate. Staff were all very pleasant. Hotel is within short walking distance of oberkampf and republique metro stations and many of the sights of paris are within walking distance. Pleasant enough area to stay in. Do try chez imogene on rue Jean-Pierre Timbaud (couple of streets away) for fantastic crepes at a very reasonable price (very small restaurant so may need to book). Beware of 'found a gold ring' trick by immigrants - its not gold - they are conning you. In a 3 day stay they tried it on us 5 times and we saw it done on many others - the police seem to turn a blind eye!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value For Money in the Centre of Paris!”
Reviews.Author: adrieire
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for the first time 9 years ago, as a single young woman visiting Paris... this time around I travelled and stayed with my husband and 2 young children. I have enjoyed both my stays. The hotel rates are incredibly low for a hotel within the city centre of Paris (it's not right in the city centre, but there are at least 3 Metro stations within walking distance), the staff are very friendly and attentive and the facilities are adequate for a hotel of its size and category. Breakfast is a typical French petit dejeuner - if you want a cooked breakfast or a buffet, you're staying in the wrong place. But they have a good selection of hot drinks and they are very accommodating to young children.They offer free Wi-Fi in your room which is an added plus. The area seems to be very lively on weekends which would probably be good for young people, but it will disrupt anyone else's sleep. This was the only flaw I could find. If you want basic, inexpensive accommodation to stay in Paris, I wholeheartedly recommend this hotel. I have stayed twice now and will definitely do it again.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: alldon
Reviews.Content: This small hotel is close to the Place de la Republique in the 11e arrondissment about 20 minutes walk from Notre Dame. The rooms are small but very clean with TV and en suite bathroom. The shower was excellent with really hot water. This is a budget city hotel so there are no frills eg no air conditioning which made for a slightly uncomfortable hot Parisian night. The surrounding area isn't quiet either so take ear plugs if you like peace and quiet but it is close to bars.shops, restaurants and a metro station is 5 minutes walk. The reception desk is staffed 24 hours and staff do speak some English. The rate includes breakfast which is the usual juice and croissants but it is plentiful. There is no parking but there is a parking garage about 5 minutes walk away which can be reserved and paid for on-line at Paris Parking Pass. It is cheaper to pay on-line than at the garage. As a base for a tourist visit to Paris where you want to be fairly near the centre but not pay ridiculous prices this hotel is very adequate.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and cheerful, but bring ear plugs!”
Reviews.Author: spyderUK Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: The room was comfortable and clean, nice shower with loads of hot water. For some reason the bedding needed changing when we got there but the staff were happy to do this. Bedding, carpet and curtains were old but OK. As others have said, very little soundproofing from the outside world, also other rooms' doors being shut and people in the corridor could be heard clearly, I would recommend ear plugs for a good night's sleep. Breakfast was basic (bread roll, croissant and pain du chocolat) with coffee, tea and orange juice. Staff were happy to refill if asked. Could eat from 7am to 10am. Had to leave key at reception every time we went out, but the hotel reception is staffed 24 hours a day so no problem. This hotel isn't the Ritz, doesn't pretend to be the Ritz and costs less than the Ritz - we chose on price and location. If your holiday needs include a posh hotel, don't stay here. If you're just looking for somewhere to crash for the night after sampling Parisian night life then it is ideal.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely only truly a 1-star!”
Reviews.Author: EarthGopher
Reviews.Content: The room itself was aesthetically hideous. The bathroom door had a patched hole that was unpainted. There was mold on the shower curtain and bathroom walls. The bathroom corners and floors and bathtub were dirty. The bathroom towels were all hand towels - no bath towels. The beds must have beeen at least 10 years old. It was as noisy as if the windows were open because they were so thin and old. There was no art in the lobby or rooms. We had to leave our key at the desk when we came and left like a hostel. The water didn't get hot the first day - only luke warm. The room was so small that you could barely get by the bed to get to the bathroom. An overall unsatisfying experience. There is no way that this hotel was awarded 3 or even 2 stars and if so, I would like to see the credentials of the organization that awarded them! Friendly staff and we liked the funky location but the hotel was funky in a bad way

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, clean and very good value”
Reviews.Author: BibiManchester
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 3 nights at hotel de mericourt. The staff were wonderful. They recommended places to visit, as well as provided us with extra pillows. The breakfast was just hat we wanted, a typical french breakfast. The rooms were immaculate, everything worked well. We really had a wonderful time.

Reviews.Title: “Great little place!!! Exceeded our expectations.”
Reviews.Author: nathsal
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights over new year 2009-2010 and we loved it! we agree with previous reviewers - great location, near to shops, bars and restaurants (especially 'Arlecchino' a great, cheap little italian round the corner) and near to metro stations. yes the rooms are small but not compared to many other city hotel rooms. yes the breakfast was just tea or coffee, orange juice and breads (croissant, pain au chocolat and a bread roll) but it was enough to start the day. The staff were all lovely and really helpful and had pretty good english - they even taught us some more french! we booked through easyclicktravel.com and paid about Â£60 per night for a double room including breakfast, over new year, in a good location in paris - amazing value we think. our only very minor comments - whilst the room and bathroom were very clean and our room felt newly refurbished with new carpets and paint, the bedding was old and tired (but clean). the bathroom was fine and clean but they could have done with a new shower curtain (the shower by the way was fabulous! - felt like the riot police had turned the water cannon on you!) - these really are minor points to give a balanced view. overall, we had a great experience at the mericourt. we would definitely stay there again and would recommend it if you are looking for a value (not high end luxury) hotel option.

Reviews.Title: “wondeful hotel”
Reviews.Author: shiri_9
Reviews.Content: it was my first time in paris, and i expected for the worst .. but the rooms was in a perfect size for us (not to small), the staff were great !! even with the inglish (consider to ather pariz citizens ..) we realy liked the location, in the middle of a quiet street with coffeshops restaurants and all the importent stors, not far away for the metro station (5 min' walking). if you'r a big guy ,you possibly sould take towel with you, becouse they are relly small, although we maneged. i had a wonderful time in pariz and the l'hotel de mericourt was a realy big part of that.

Reviews.Title: “Good price Great location”
Reviews.Author: McBiskit
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay here 10 years apart. Love the location with easy access to Paris with 2 metro lines nearby. Rooms are small, but normal for Paris with small bathrooms that could be cleaner but the water was hot and plentiful. Towels were small but clean and they did the job. Breakfast breads were fresh but would not recommend the coffee. Staff were very helpful and friendly - most spoke some English. Definitely will stay here if I ever get to Paris again

Reviews.Title: “Good Clean Accommodation.”
Reviews.Author: barca72scotland
Reviews.Content: This hotel was more than adequate for a 3 day stay where my only concern was to have somewhere to wash and sleep for 2 nights! The rooms and public areas were very clean and there was ample space in the single room I had for bags, clothes, etc. Only a 10 minute metro ride to most of Paris' main attractions and plenty bars and restaurants right on your doorstep. Breakfast was very basic with tea/coffee, croissant and bread & jam. But hey, we cant eat bacon and eggs every day! Will definately use this hotel again if I ever return toParis.

Reviews.Title: “A fine budget hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: annmarkus
Reviews.Content: This is a budget hotel in Paris, and it has many of the features you expect from such a place: very small room, worn and mismatched linens, stained carpet. However, it has very friendly, helpful staff; cheerful attractive lobby/breakfast room, a good breakfast; and a quiet location very near a Metro Station (Oberkamp). I recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Still a good value for the price :-)”
Reviews.Author: poussemoussu
Reviews.Content: It was my second stay at the HÃ´tel de MÃ©ricourt and like last year, the staff was extremely friendly and the room very decent for the price you pay. They sure could do a better job cleaning the bathroom (some mildew in some places) but overall it is very good for Paris and well situated. The breakfast was great: croissant, pain au chocolat and baguette.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for what it is”
Reviews.Author: childbride84
Reviews.Content: First, it's important to understand what this hotel is not. It's not the Holiday Inn somewhere in America. The hotel is small, the elevator is small (though not nonexistent, as one earlier review stated), and the rooms and bathrooms are small. If you're looking for a big suite with a pull-out sofa and a mini-bar, this isn't your place. If you're looking for a clean, comfortable, convenient place to camp out while you're seeing Paris, and you don't want to pay a fortune, this is your place. My wife and I stayed for two nights during our first trip to Paris. The hotel is in a quiet neighborhood within two blocks of a Metro station (Oberkampf). The room was small and not in perfect cosmetic condition (scuff marks and a few stains, a chipped tile or two), but the heating and bathroom worked perfectly. It had a hair dryer and closet, but no alarm clock or phone. We were able to walk almost everywhere we went in town from here. There are also several bus lines and Velib (bicycle rental) kiosks within walking distance. It is completely possible to reach the hotel from CDG airport by public transportation. The front desk staff spoke some English and was very helpful. Breakfast (included in our room rate) was coffee or hot chocolate with bread and pastries. Paris is an extremely expensive city. The Mericourt was a good way not to blow our budget on lodging.

Reviews.Title: “friendly family hotel a definite reccomendation”
Reviews.Author: hotsaltbeef
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 days in early december. we went for a twin room Breakfast was continental type included in price. its approx 10 mins to the marais fast walking or 20-25 mins shop browsing at the same time. its set away one street from from the main road and the rooms were compact - but ideal as a place to sleep after a long day around the louvre. unlike singapore were i love to spend time channel hopping the hundreds of tv channels -paris for me is culture not tv in the room. we were given a code word by some friends ref: COCO and the price quoted was Â£50 gbp (approx 80 euro or $110 per night) for 2 persons including breakfast -im told that this price was only for off peak (not holidays and trade fairs) im not sure how long this offer was on for. the room was clean - we chose a en suite bath instead of shower. all round we were pleasantly happy and will rebook when we come back next year.

Reviews.Title: “Not Near to Expectations”
Reviews.Author: mel4
Reviews.Content: The hotel rooms are like cubicles with very thin walls. You can hear everything. Cleanliness was questionable and the shower was a very tiny space. This was not what i had expected. The positive was that the staff was polite and helpful. I would not recommend this place. Also, it was far removed from the Marais.

HotelInfo.Name: L'Hotel de Mericourt
HotelInfo.Address: 50 rue de La Mericourt, 75011 Paris, France
